pageContext.claim: “Michael Cohen plead guilty to two counts of campaign finance violations that are not a crime. President Obama had a big campaign finance violation and it was easily settled!”
pageContext.analysis: The Cohen and Obama cases are quite different. A {Washington Post} report explained, "A case like Obama’s — which was a civil infraction — is much more common and less serious than a criminal cases such as Cohen’s, in which there was a knowing violation of election law that carries prison time." In other words, Trump's assessment should be reversed.
